newsitem.title: GREECE: A STRONGER DRACHMA IS LIKELY IN THE NEAR-TERM-CITI.
newsitem.headline: A STRONGER DRACHMA IS LIKELY IN THE NEAR-TERM-CITI.

text.p: An unsustainable appreciation of the drachma could be in the offing in the short-run even if the Greek authorities cut interest rates, said Citibank, London in its November report.

"Notwithstanding our bearish fundamental outlook on the Greek currency because of the external position, it is entirely possible that an unsustainable burst of appreciation could be in the offing in the near-term," it said.
Greece's European Union convergence programme rules out fiscal laxity and some offsetting monetary easing is required to discourage capital inflows, it said.
"This too could attract a rush of foreign capital to lock in rates," the report added.
